availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
December 11th 1865
McCracken County Court
Regular Term

Presant G A. Flournoy Judge ordered that Fayette Harrison be Recommended to the Governor of Kentucky as a Suitable person to fill the office of Justice of the Peace in district No 5 in McCracke County in the place of Thos S, Long Resigned

A Copy Attest
J K Leeman C m c c

December 11th 1865
McCracken County Court
Regular Term

Presant G. A. Flournoy Jdg Ordered that James. H, Reed be recommended to the Governor of Ky as a Suitable person to fill the office of Justice of the Peace in district No 6 in place of Wm Simpson who Refuse to qualify

Copy Attest
J K Leeman c m c c

Justice Peace
McCracken Co
apptd
29 Decr/65
